paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.feature import HashingTF, IDF, Tokenizer, StopWordsRemover

%pyspark
# Read in data from S3 Buckets
from pyspark import SparkFiles
from pyspark.sql.functions import col,sum
url ="https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/data-bootcamp-kmc/CleanedGunViolenceData.csv"
spark.sparkContext.addFile(url)
df = spark.read.csv(SparkFiles.get("CleanedGunViolenceData.csv"), sep=",", header=True)
df = df.where(col("incident_characteristics").isNotNull()) 
df = df.select('incident_characteristics')
# Show DataFrame
df.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import col,sum
df.select(*(sum(col(c).isNull().cast("int")).alias(c) for c in df.columns)).show()

%pyspark
# Remove stop words
stop_list = ["||"]
remover = StopWordsRemover(inputCol="words", outputCol="filtered", stopWords=stop_list)
removed_frame = remover.transform(tokened_transformed)
removed_frame.show(truncate=False)

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Run the hashing term frequency
hashing = HashingTF(inputCol="filtered", outputCol="hashedValues", numFeatures=pow(2,4))

# Transform into a DF
hashed_df = hashing.transform(removed_frame)
hashed_df.show()

%pyspark
# Fit the IDF on the data set 
idf = IDF(inputCol="hashedValues", outputCol="features")
idfModel = idf.fit(hashed_df)
rescaledData = idfModel.transform(hashed_df)
